description.p: Please answer the questions below. Your response will not be graded, but will be available for your instructor to read. Answering these questions may also shape the discussions in class.

likert_series.prompt: Evaluate your ability to perform each of the following tasks. In other words, how well can you do each task?

item.prompt: Gross and microscopic anatomy of the urinary tract, including detailed histology of the nephron.
Identify and describe the functional process of urine formation, including filtration, reabsorption, and secretion.
Identify and describe factors regulating & altering urine volume & composition, including the renin-angiotensin system & the roles of aldosterone, antidiuretic hormone, & the natriuretic peptides.
Describe glomerular filtration rate (GFR), state the average value of GFR, and explain how clearance rate can be used to measure GFR.
List specific transport mechanisms occurring in different parts of the nephron, including active transport and osmosis.
Define countercurrent multiplication and countercurrent exchange, and describe how this relates to urine formation.
Describe the last portion of urine transport and collection for elimination.
Describe the micturition reflex and the voluntary and involuntary neural control of micturition.

open_response.prompt: What concept or topic is the least clear to you at this point?
Please write any other questions you would like the instructor to address in class.
